lead_paragraph: In a cruel blow, California ushered in the New Year with a ban on smoking in the holy of holies -- bars -- and as usual in these skirmishes there's strong opposition. Well, at this point, mostly there's just Raymond Sasso, president of Forces (Fight Ordinances and Restrictions to Control and Eliminate Smoking), a two-year-old California group dedicated to puffer justice. Sasso, 45, admits that there's not much he can do -- he recently sent out a tart ''European advisory'' to urge tourists to boycott the Golden State -- so he's putting his hopes on civil disobedience. ''Police have better things to do,'' he says, citing rumors that the law will be widely ignored, ''than give someone a ticket for smoking in a bar.''
abstract: California ushers in New Year with ban on smoking in bars amid strong opposition (S)
